article_title: New Gay-Rights Push Faces Uphill Climb in Congress
article_text:
WASHINGTON—More than a year ago, gay-rights advocates hatched a plan to advance their cause after an expected Supreme Court ruling legalizing same-sex marriage. The idea: craft federal legislation to prohibit discrimination in jobs, financial transactions, housing and other aspects of public life.

Executing the plan has turned out to be far more complicated than they anticipated. The bill has yet to be introduced even though the favorable court ruling came last month. There is disagreement about how to balance religious...

twitter.description: Advocates promote a bill in Congress to end discrimination against gays, but Republicans, some African-American leaders push back.
twitter.creator: @laurameckler

image.alt: New gay-rights push faces uphill climb in Congress

article_summary:
WASHINGTON—More than a year ago, gay-rights advocates hatched a plan to advance their cause after an expected Supreme Court ruling legalizing same-sex marriage.
The bill has yet to be introduced even though the favorable court ruling came last month.
The idea: craft federal legislation to prohibit discrimination in jobs, financial transactions, housing and other aspects of public life.
Executing the plan has turned out to be far more complicated than they anticipated.
There is disagreement about how to balance religious...
